main_definition: To observe or look at attentively, especially with a clock or similar device used to measure time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Passively observed an event or activity without active engagement
meanings_and_examples.example: I watched the game from my couch.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Kept a record of time passing, usually by looking at a clock or similar device
meanings_and_examples.example: She checked her watch every five minutes to see how long she had been waiting.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To pay attention and carefully observe something with interest
meanings_and_examples.example: He watched the sunset over the ocean, mesmerized by its beauty.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having witnessed or experienced an event firsthand
meanings_and_examples.example: She has never watched a solar eclipse before and was excited to experience it.
